row.col: This article is as few or no other articles link to it. Please help in articles on related topics. (January 2008)''

bdy.p:
Donoor is a small village in the
Karimnagar district of
Andhra Pradesh , which is located in the backward
Telangana
region. It is a small gram- panchayat with a population of just around 2500. It is around 8 kilometers from the temple town
Dharmapuri .

ss1.p: A small government funded primary care center supervised by a trained health care worker provides health education and first aid services. It does have a few registered medical practitioners (RMP) who does help provide first aid. However it is an health care underserved area, with the nearest physician services available some 8 kilometers away. Lack of proper transportation services makes the availability of timely health care difficult.

The irony is that there are several medical practitioners and very well educated people in India and abroad who can trace back their roots to this tiny village, but none of them have given back anything to this unfortunate village and its people . This village can benefit from the services and contributions of all those who can trace back their roots to this tiny village.
This village has a government upper primary school, which provides education for around 224 students. There are five secondary grade teachers and one ancillary staff.
